title: Burnt Honey Shortbread
method: Place honey in a small saucepan over medium heat (not high = toffee)
Cook 2-3 minutes until slightly darkened.
Cool at room temperature for ten minutes.
(I changed methods here: instead of bench top mixer I used the food processor.)
Place butter, sugar, flour and 1tsp vanilla and pulse until fine crumbs.
Or mix with paddle attachment 1-2mins on low speed.
Add burnt honey and pinch of salt.
Pulse until well combined.
Shape dough into a 20cm x 5cm round log wrap in cling wrap, place in fridge for two hours or up to four days. (I made two smaller logs)
Pre heat oven to 180ÂºC.
Line baking trays with baking paper.
Unwrap dough, trim ends and slice into 1cm rounds.
Place 3cm apart and bake for 12-14 mins until golden (not brown!) Set aside to cool (16-18 biscuits).
Icing
Place extra honey in saucepan and heat on medium until runny.
Transfer to a bowl, add icing sugar  milk and remaining teaspoon of vanilla.
Mix to combine.
Place 1tspn of icing to a cooled biscuit and spread with back of spoon.
Depending on size of your biscuit you may use less.
Try to leave a little edge around the biscuit.
Store in airtight container for a week.
